chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brady L. Mevis

records.addlTxt: 10:08 AM Room 301 Defendant Brady L. Mevis appeared by video, in custody in LCJ.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup appeared by video for Brady L. Mevis.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court cases cases 22CF11 & 21CF135 together. Def consents to being by zoom and can hear all parties. Plea agreement. State recommends def plea on 22CF11 - ct. 1 - DRI, ct. 2 - DRI, ct. 3 - DRI. On 21CF135 - Ct.1 - withhold sentence, probation 3 yrs concurrent, court costs, DNA sample unless already provided, AODA treatment, Maintain Absolute Sobriety, Maintain Fulltime Employment, no contact w victim from both cases, obtain any counseling deemed necessary by agent. Ct. 2 - imposed and stayed 2 yrs, 18 mo initial confinement, 6 mo extended supervision, consecutive, probation 2 yrs concurrent, costs, DNA, comply with conditions as stated in ct. 1. Ct. 3 - serve time served sentence with credit from both cases, pay costs with DNA surcharge. State has complied with victims rights in both cases. State notes victim wanted to attend all proceedings. Off record @ 10:16 AM. Back on record @ 10:18 AM. Defense notes victim not wanting to be present. State notes victim in 21CF135 wanted to share a victim impact statement but does not want to share anymore. Court reviews plea questionnaire. Def plea no contest to cts. 1, 2, & 3 in 21CF135. Court grants to DRI cts. 1, 2, & 3 in 22CF11. Court advises def of constitutional rights. Court reviews elements and penalties. Def enters pleas freely. Court warns of possible deportation. Def atty. is satisfied. Court finds def freely entering plea agreement. Factual basis. Court accepts def pleas. Court finds def guilty of cts. 1,2 & 3 in 21CF135. Sentencing remarks by state. Sentencing remarks by defense. No remarks by defendant. Remarks by court. Court will abide by plea agreement. Court orders on 21CF135 - Ct.1 - withheld sentence, 3 yrs probation concurrent, court costs only, DNA sample unless already provided, $250 surcharge, continuation AODA treatment, Maintain Absolute Sobriety, Maintain Fulltime Employment or be seeking, no contact with victim from both cases, obtain/participate in any counseling deemed necessary by agent. Ct. 2 - 2 yrs imposed and stayed, 18 mo initial confinement, 6 mo extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence, 2 yrs probation concurrent, court costs only, DNA sample unless already provided, comply with conditions as stated in ct 1. Ct. 3 -  time served sentence with credit from both cases, court costs only, DNA sample unless already provided, $200 surcharge. The $1000 will be used to retire most of court costs, rest of balance can be paid during probation. On Ct. 2 if revoked, def is eligible for earned release and challenge incarceration program. Count 3 credit, 29 days from 22CF11, 255 days from 21CF135, total credit 284 days. Fire arms restrictions and voting restrictions given. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights given. 284 days credit.

Court calls 21CF135 & 22CF11 @ 1:40 PM/Rm 203. Defendant Brady L. Mevis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Brady L. Mevis.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. State requests victim appear via phone. Atty Gramstrup advises Def. wishes to waive preliminary hearing in both cases. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing with respect to both cases. Atty Gramstrup replies regarding offer. Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing rights with Def. Def. wishes to file for speedy trial if cases are not dismissed and confirms waiver of prelim hearing. Atty Gramstrup agrees. Court accepts waiver on 21Cf135 & 22Cf11 and finds probable cause. Bond remains.
Arraignment scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

for Motion to Dismiss
(Routed to Judge's JA)
Preliminary hearing on September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

and Notice of Motion for Dismissal
(Routed to Judge's JA)

8:30 AM/Room 203. Defendant Brady L. Mevis appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Brady L. Mevis.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All appearances are by Zoom. 21CF135 and 22CF11. Attny Gramstrup heard on motion to modify bond. State objects to modification. State has complied with victim rights. Court questions counsel as to current bail. Remarks by the Court. The Court denies motion, bond continues as previously set in both form and amount.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
in Support of Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: 02:30 PM in Room 301. Defendant Brady L. Mevis in court with attorney Cana G Kohn.  Defendant Brady L. Mevis in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brady L. Mevis appeared by video means with Attorney. All appearances are by Zoom. 22CF11 and 21CF135. Withdrawal of counsel request has been filed. Def. confirms he wants a new attorney.  Def. waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver of time limits in 22CF11. Court allows Attny Kohn to withdraw from both cases.  Status conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Motion and prop. order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Letter to Request Adjournment of Preliminary Hearing Until New Counsel Can Be Appointed
Routed to JA
No contact with victim or victim residence - Refused to sign

01:20 PM Defendant Brady L. Mevis in court with attorney Cana G Kohn.  Defendant Brady L. Mevis in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brady L. Mevis appeared by video means with Attorney. All parties via zoom.  Atty Kohn has copy of complaint, waives reading. Bond needs to be set.  State gives bail/bond recommendation.  Def. is on a probation hold. Atty Kohn doesn't object.  Court orders $5,000 cash bond with conditions. Atty Kohn request timely p.h.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
